channel.title: Indie Film Nation
channel.itunes:author: Mike Smith
channel.description: Australian movie junkie Mike Smith dives deep into the world of independent with a collective of filmmakers from around the globe. Think of it as IFC meets the Crocodile Hunter meets Ain't It Cool News. Smith covers all the film festivals, interviews up-and-coming directors, and talks about productions in progress. Immigrate to Indie Film Nation and leave corporate cinema in the dust.
channel.itunes:subtitle: the weekly independent film podcast from around the globe to your computer, iPod or MP3

item.title: Fredrik Gertten (director) of Big Boys Gone Bananas (SWE)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Sue Lawson interviews Fredrik Gertten (director) of Big Boys Gone Bananas (2012), Sweden, feature documentary during the films world premiere at the Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah.  

BIg Boys Gone Bananas tells the story of Gretten documentary, Banana's when the Dole Food Company waged a campaign to prevent a pair of Swedish filmmakers from showing their documentary about a lawsuit against the company.

item.title: Steve James (director) of The Interrupters (USA)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
On this episode, Sue Lawson speaks to award winning documentary filmmaker, Steve James (director, editor, dp and producer) of The Interrupters (USA), 2011 about his brand new feature documentary which is a colloborations with award winning author and journalist, Alex Kotlowitz (There are No Children Here: The Story of Two Boys Growing Up in the Other America).

The Interrupters tells the moving and surprising stories of three violence interrupters who try to protect their Chicago communities from the violence they themselves once employed within their own communities.

item.title: Jon Hewitt (co-writer/director) of X (AUS) (Repost)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #049: Jon Hewitt (co-writer/director) of X, Australia, dramatic feature film that recently had it's festival premiere at Melbourne International Film Festival on the 4th August 2011.

WARNING: this interview contains some offensive language and nudity in a clip from the film.

"X" is a dramatic thriller by Jon Hewitt and Belinda McClory who have taking us onto the streets of the infamous Kings Cross in Sydney, Australia.  The story takes place over a 24 hour period for a couple of working girls who find themselves fighting for their lives.

Hewitt delivers a roller coaster adventure with two power house performance by Viva Bianca and Hanna Mangan Lawrence in a very accomplished and riveting thriller that delivers way beyond it's very modest budget.

X is currently available on Video On Demand on the IFC and is receiving a theatrical release in a number of countries in the coming months.

For more information visit:  X Official Blog

item.title: Bjoern Richie Lob (director) of Keep Surfing (GER)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #049: Bjoern Richie Lob (director) of Keep Surfing (Germany) feature documentary.

Keep Surfing is a very unique edition to the surf genre of films.  When you think of great surfing destination certainly Germany would be feature high in the best place to catch waves.  But never let that stop Germany from having it's own surf culture in the heart of Munich.

Bjoern Richie Lob (director) bring us to the banks of a river in Munich were a unique group of keen surfers gather to catch a wave.

Keep Surfing screened as part of the Audi Festival of German Film in Australia but has played the Tribeca Film Festival in 2010.

item.title: Rashid Ghazi (Director) of Fordson (USA)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Interview with Rashid Ghazi (Director) of Fordson (USA) a feature length documentary film that follows four talented high school football players from Dearborn Michigan as they gear up for their big senior year rivalry game during the last ten days of Ramadan, a month when Muslims traditionally fast every day from sunrise to sundown.

Fordson premiered at the Slamdance Film Festival 2011 at Park City, Utah.

item.title: Göran Olsson (director) of The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975 (Sweden)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #046

Interview with Göran Olsson (director) of The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975 (Sweden) a feature documentary film that screened in the World Documentary Competition of the Sundance Film Festival 2011 and at the Berlinale Film Festival.

The footage was shot by a group of Swedish journalists whose footage had languished in a basement for 30 years which has been constructed into a mesmerizing journey through the Black Panther activities during that era.

item.title: Lilly Ayers (director) and Danielle Bernal (assoc. producer) of Last Fast Ride (USA)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #045: Interview with Lilly Scourtis Ayers(director) and Danielle Bernal (associate producer) of Last Fast Ride (2011), USA, documentary feature film recorded during the film's world premiere in the documentary competition of the Slamdance Film Festival 2011.

Last Fast Ride chronicles the life and times of Marian Anderson the would-be rock star who was one of the Bay Area's most provocative and controversial lead singers of the '90s punk scene. The fetish model and dominatrix quickly became known for her wild and lewd live sex acts during performances, which often involved other women and bananas. Narrated by pop-culture icon Henry Rollins.

item.title: Michael Barnett (director) and Zimmer (superhero) of Superheroes (USA)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
On this episode, Bruce Himmelblau interviews Michael Barnett, Co-Writer/Director and Director of Photography of Superheroes (USA) during the film's world premiere at the Slamdance Film Festival in the Documentary Competition of the festival.

Michael Barnett is joined by Zimmer, real life superhero, as they discuss this incredibly engaging and enjoyable documentary that takes into the world of those people who patrol the streets of USA cities dressed in homemade costumes.  The names of Mr. Xtreme, Master Legend, Thanatos, Zetaman, Life, Dark Guardian, The New York Initiative and Xtreme Justice League may not be as iconic as the fictional superheroes created by Stan Lee but it's worthy of spending 90 minutes with on this adventure on the mean streets. They have no special powers but strong sense of justice, at times misguided but at least their honest and genuine souls.

Superheroes was shot on Canon 5D which Michael Barnett demonstrates what powerful camera can be in the hands of very clever and brilliant cinematography.

item.title: Glen Porter (writer) of I Melt With You (USA)
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #043:  Interview with Glenn Porter (writer) of I Melt with You (USA) dramatic feature film at the world premiere of the film during the Sundance Film Festival 2011. 
  
Synopsis:
Richard (Thomas Jane), Ron (Jeremy Piven), Tim (Christian McKay), and Jonathan (Rob Lowe) are friends from college who gather for a weekend each year to celebrate their friendship and catch up with each other. On the surface, they look like other men going through life: they have careers and families and responsibilities. But as with many people, there is more to them than meets the eye. As the weekend progresses, they go down the rabbit hole of excess. Fueled by sex, drugs, and rock 'n' roll, their bacchanalian reunion drives them to an unexpected place where they are forced to confront themselves and the choices they’ve made.

Writer/director Mark Pellington returns to the Sundance Film Festival with a riveting and emotionally raw story that puts the modern male psyche under the knife, opening it up and exposing it for what it is. The four leads deliver crackling performances as they dig deeply within themselves to portray painfully honest characters. What emerges is a visually dazzling, sonically charged exploration of men on the brink of enlightenment . . . whether they want it or not.
item.itunes:subtitle: Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #043: Interview with Glenn Porter (writer) of I Melt With You (USA)
item.itunes:summary: Indie Film Nation Video Podcast #043: Interview with Glenn Porter (writer) of I Melt With You (USA)
item.itunes:keywords: city, festival, film, Grey, Jane, jeremy, Lowe, mark, park, Pellington

item.title: Indie Film Nation #071 for 13th April 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Smith
item.description:
Interview with Stephen Tramontana (Writer/Director) of Grindhouse (USA) feature film made in 2002 and who has accused Quentin Tarantino of ripping off their film for his new film project with Robert Rodgriuez.  Tramontana has released his film for download for only 99 cents at The Real Grindhouse

Bryan Singer vs Gus Van Sant - both are making new films about the Harvey Milk murder in San Franscisco

Anne Thompson from Variety magazine reports that independent filmmakers are now using online distribution strategies like Amazon Unboxed to release their films and details Linda Nelson and Michael Madsen experience of distributing their film Shifted (USA) on Amazon.  Madsen appeared on Indie Film Nation #039 on the 19th March 2006 discussing exactly this strategy over year before the industry papers picked on this trend.

Preview the forthcoming San Francisco International Film from the 26th April to 10th May 2007

 

Music from the Podsafe Music Network

Had Enough by Frenzal Rhomb (AUS) from Fat Wreck Records (USA)

Sleepwalker by Sender (AUS)
